1561066486_1HiSNH8Uh5LSRjqxtrZrBUEquny9D.body: Parrot OS seems to be the best starting point for you, otherzise give zorin a try

1561122126_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
how are you going to handle security updates?
how are you going to perform stability tests?
how can some amateur work performed from time to time give better results than years of professional work done my dozens of people paid to do a quality job that complies with strict standards??

there is a reason why sometimes linux distributions have to make some choices, and usually these choices come with benefits for the final users. you just don't know (or understand) such reasons and the derived benefits, and i strongly invite you to take a look at them, or to pick a linux distro (or a different branch of your current os) that suits your needs.
